job_description: Financial Analyst Administrative Day Laborer - job post City of Everett 23 reviews Everett, WA 98201 • Hybrid remote Full-time, Temporary You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Temporary JOB The City of Everett’s Parks and Facilities Department is accepting applications for a Financial Analyst Administrative Day Laborer. This position is temporary, up to 6 months in duration, and will work 24-40 hours per week, depending on qualified applicants preference. This is work providing assistance and support to the Senior Financial Analyst. This position is not provided with City of Everett benefits. About the Department Everett Parks and Facilities is committed to providing parks and facilities that enhance the quality of life and increase accessibility to every resident. Become a part of a team who act as stewards to preserve, protect, and enhance public lands and facilities. Parks and Facility employees work in independent and team capacities creating a strong City workforce. NATURE OF WORKThis is work providing assistance and support to the Parks and Facilities Department. Duties would include, but are not limited to: Reconcile daily recreation and golf transactionsReconcile and process purchase card receiptsProcess invoicesSupport department payroll entry and reconciliation Hours: This position is up to 40 hours per week, Monday through Friday. A hybrid work schedule with at least 2 days per week in office is negotiable. SKILL AND ABILITY TO: Analyze and interpret statistical data and accounting records to prepare comprehensive financial statements and reports.Assist in the formulation of the preliminary and final budget documents. Assist in the preparation of budget requests and forecast operating expenses and revenues; compile budgets for each functional area; research and analyze data; assist in resolution of budget issues and requests for information; provide assistance to department and divisions as needed.Create, update, review and monitor various projects and project costs based on transfers, allocation and funding source; conduct analysis and job cost reviews. Maintain an efficient job costing system for use in monitoring and analyzing specific cost centers and projects.Operate in accordance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles; provide for proper accounting controls. Prepare journal entries for city accounts; analyze financial data for discrepancies and errors and advise of corrections.Assist with the preparation of grant revenue and cash flow forecasting; monitor reports as required.Assist with the review and monitor various projects and project costs based on transfers, allocation and funding source; conduct analysis and job cost reviews.Analyze data, prepare claims, maintain records and prepare for audits as required.Monitor accounts receivable functions, including preparing statements and billings, reviewing requests for billings.Develop appropriate financial models for specific projects.Prepare reports; monitor departmental and interfund billings.Provide information on all areas of cost and revenue as requested.Have pleasant and professional interaction with supervisor, team members, and the public. Understand and follow verbal and written directions and to apply available guidelines to recurring operational requirements. Communicate effectively verbally and in writing. Proficient in the use of all office equipment including personal computers and related software applications (Microsoft Suite).Be consistently available and self-motivated. Establish and meet deadlines.Support diversity and multi-cultural understanding in the workplace. Maintain a work environment free of discrimination, harassment, and retaliation. Perform related work and special projects as assigned.QUALIFICATIONS Demonstrative experience in basic principles of municipal finance, monitoring, GAAP and BARS.Successfully complete a background check.Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration or a related field, and2 years related experience.Municipal accounting experience preferred.CPA license, highly desirable.APPLICATION PROCEDURESApplication materials may be accessed via http://www.everettwa.gov/careers. Completed applications must be submitted through the City’s online application system. INCOMPLETE, FAXED, OR EMAILED APPLICATIONS WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED. Filing Opens: 3/22/23Open Until FilledL23018
